Your name is Jacob. You are 12 years old, and scare VERY easily. When you woke up you were in a VERY dark room. There is a bad storm raging outside, and the only time you could get a decent lighting was when lightning struck. You could hear the sound of a piano somewhere near. You start walking around aimlessly to try, and see where it's coming from. You walk right into something very long, and thing. Once you hit it, it made a low sound. Kind of like a guitar. "Hmmm! What was that?" You here a female voice say. It sounded teenage. You start rapidly looking around, because right after you heard that the piano music stopped. What you saw horrified you. A girl who appeared to be 18 years old, wearing an old looking red dress. that wasn't what scared you. She had glowing blue skin, and pure yellow eyes. She also had long golden hair (http://www.mariowiki.com/images/thumb/a/...). You are frozen in fear for a few seconds. The girl then gets up, and goes over to the guitar to investigate. It then dawns on you that you have to run! You turn to run, but the thing is you run right into the guitar string again. "Hmmm, what are you?" The girl asked. You are too afraid to answer. All that exits your mouth is "I... Uh... P-P-P...". "I can tell your afraid. How could you not be? If I could scare normal sized humans on site, there is no doubt in my mind someone your size would be terrified by a ghost like me." The girl said. "P-P-P-Please d-d-don't hurt m-me!" You plead.

"Tell you what small one. If you can pass my test, then I shall let you go unscathed... But if you fail, then you shall stay with me, and be tormented for eternity." The ghost girl said. You are frozen in fear, and can't move. She takes your silence as a yes, and takes you to her piano. "It's simple... I shall play one of my songs, and you must guess what it is..." She said. She then began to play the following tune...

Da da da. Da da da da. Da da da da. Da da da da da.

"You seem stressed, lil' krill. Don't worry, I know just the thing that'll help you relax and have a totally brand new outlook on life, even."
The giant slug gently slid her foot forward as she spoke, the very end of the sandal touching his chest and pushing him backwards, until she had him laying with his back on the ground under her sandal. She, of course, noticed his attempt to right himself and held him down with a finger. "Now, don't move. We, like, can't have you all chilled out if you're moving all around the place."

With her other hand, he saw her take off both of her sandals on either side of his body. The regular schlk sound one would expect to hear was absent, instead replaced by a more viscous sound, evident by the light layer of sticky slime on her soles. Little strings of slime were even visible, connecting from her foot to the sandal's insole, snapping straight to her foot as she pulled the footwear far away enough. The sandals were tossed off to the side, her attention now focused on her teeny guest.

She pulled her finger away from his chest, and upon seeing him sit there in awe at her large feet, gained a smug smile. "Pretty rockin' feet, yeah? Hope you like 'em, krill~" She hung her left foot over him, toes wiggling in the air and slime already slowly dripping from her sole like syrup. Little by little, it took up more of his vision, the smell getting stronger until it and the foot were fully on top of him. It nearly covered him completely! He felt the sheer weight of it push down against him, her toes flexing and contracting to find a comfortable spot with his head between them. From above, he heard her slow, drawn-out voice. "Name's Flow, by the way. And now, just chillll~"
Flow began to rhythmically, methodically, rub her foot against his tiny body, the pressure shifting back and forth on top of him. He felt more of the slime drip down, getting on his arms and legs, but it felt... good, in a way. Calming, even...

You waved an arm up at her, yelling up to the sky. "Marina! Hey!" She, however, stayed looking off into the distance. You cupped your hands to your mouth, practically screaming now. "Excuse me! Marina!?" Still no direct response, though she was nodding her head gently. You walked over to her huge black boot, knocking on it in hopes that she would at least feel it. ...nope, nothing. Just then, you looked up and saw her turn her head to the side, revealing to you her pair of headphones, letting you know that getting her attention through yelling was out of the question.

You climbed on to the boot's side, grabbing the massive zipper's pull tab that hung onto it. Peeking over it, you saw that the rest of the boot was unzipped from this point, letting you see the end of her green leggings and a bit of her ankle. And up overhead, her long legs, disappearing inside her shorts and followed by the rest of her. You got a foot onto the top of the pull tab, now standing on top and preparing to climb her leg.

But just before you could, she started to walk. Starting with the foot you were on, it moved up and forward in the air, slowly landing back down with a deep thud. This you could handle, despite a subtle sinking feeling in your stomach, but the speed picked up the more she walked. Before long, you could barely hold on to the zipper chains on each side, causing you to fall...

Pearl and you look at window,and see some loveable squid kids trying to look in the studio.They couldn't see what are see what you three is doing,but they are definitely curious what is happening right now.

Marina's long toes continue to happily spread out and srunched back up.As the girl felt your hardworking yet perverse hands tending to her feet.She began to bit her lip with her fang, and her tentacles quickly move at the new feeling.Why does this..little peverted weirdo feels...so damn wonderful!?!

What will happen next?
15523222222211233111221.title: Proving your Worth.

choices: "I'll keep it somewhere safe in the meantime"
15523222222212.content:
As the blurriness in your eyes clears, the world spreads out further before you. The smell of ocean salts floats through your nostrils, mixing with the wet paint, and what seems like seafood. Everything looks as bright and colourful as a 90s cartoon - but it takes a few seconds before these colours end up in any understandable shapes. Some shops towering above you, flooded with odd-looking people in spats and sneakers. At your half-inch height, they looked more like ferocious krakens - mixed with glimpses of anemone and octopi. Further in the distance, buildings that pierce the sky, some with grafitti of long-dead memes and jokes sprawled on them. A few screeching seagulls pecking at the ground.

You try to move, but something glues you down. It's sticky, smooth, and spreads out like an ocean in every direction... Orange ink?

Yes, not unlike one that a squid might secrete - if more vibrant. You're splat in the middle of Inkopolis!

Suddenly, a rumble. The paint-coated floor shakes violently. The enormous birds around fly away in fear, leaving you alone to face...

Something. Something approaching at lightning speed. It looks like a tower standing high up against you, blocking the sun... Except towers don't move like that. A tower wouldn't have huge shoes that slam down in constant rhythm against steel with enough force to make it creak. A tower wouldn't make such smooth, organic movements, each joint's motion like a transformation as bits of the painted walls disappear and reappear behind the limbs' movements. A tower wouldn't have curves in its body like that, wobbling as if the creature didn't have any bones. And a tower definitely wouldn't screech like that... Or was that singing? It takes a step closer. There's a little wobble in the way it moves, a shiny reflection coming off the flesh.

Unable to move in the ink, you're left helpless as the gargantuan form pounds towards you. For just a second, you see a long stretch of pink fabric moving up into the air, tightly hugging around the plump curves of a shapely leg, folding inwards with a movement of the mighty muscles behind them. Black material glistening like fish scales compliment the backside above, poofing outwards with a little flap. And below, two black structures decorated with pink at the bottom - enormous shoes with rose soles, sides wrapped loosely around the ankles.

This thing completely consumes the world around you for that second; you feel as if you're sinking deeper inside the ink around you as the foot looms above. And with one tiny squeal from the side - "Callie!" - it falls. Your body is helplessly pressed against the pink surface, sickening squashing sounds around you. As soon as it lifts, a mixture of relief and horror washes over you. The squelch was just the sound of ink sticking to her shoe, not any bones breaking - yet, that wet clump of orange contained... you. You're plastered to the sole of the squiddy woman.

You hear her voice echoing around you. Callie - if that's what this monster is called- is humming something. Catchy, but ear-splitting at your size. The leg stretches forward, revealing you to the air - you can spot another squid-girl dressed in green in the distance, waving to someone, a small box in hand. Your face soon slams onto the cement again, harshly squeezed underneath the pressure of a sea creature's shoe.

Callie's legs seem to fly wildly into the air. You get an eyeful of her dangling ponytails, and her twisting hips, in synch with the melody - and you're slammed down again. In fact, she seems to be stepping to the rhythm of the song, the ball of her foot hitting on every beat, and lifting afterwards to come back down in a sickening pattern. Pink, orange, and green blurs move by you, assaulting your senses. No matter how much you try to pry yourself loose, your limbs remain stuck in the gloop. The past and future seem to sink further away with each stomp. You try to pull yourself away from the pain, detach yourself from the blunt slams and the moment, convince yourself it's a dream... Yet, with each footstep made to a deliberate, rapid beat, it becomes hard to imagine anything as real, vivid, and intense as this moment. Like a rollercoaster, everything rushes by. You fall in a trance with each upwards motion, giving enough time for the numbness in your body to wear out... Only to bring back the sting of ink-coated concrete as she stomps.

Your eyes sting from the salk and ink; your joints ache from the continual mashing. The worst part is the stairs - her rhythm changes on the first few steps, leaving your body unprepared for the impact. And once your body felt used to the tempo, she suddenly decided to bolt up the next flight in one horrendous dash and a single rising note. All the steps rattled harshly against you, each harder and stronger than the last. The rapid assault on your body left you panting, desperate for air.

Underneath her, you can hear a muffled, high-pitched voice:

"Can't your tentacles move any faster? Our broadcast begins in eight minutes!" There are a few crunches between the comment - as if the other person (or squid) is chewing something.

Your body shakes as the words come out directly above: "Chill, Marie. I'm just practicing some moves for our next dance."

"There are so many steps there..."

An excited squeal rings out above, as the foot tilted slightly against you. "Hey - I just came up with this totally fresh move on the way here! Wanna see it?"

"You're going to show me no matter what I answer, right, Callie?" With the shoe at this position, you can see another leg, covered in green tights, with a skirt wobbling back and forth above. Near the groin, gloved hands reach into a box of french fries, scooping them towards this second squid's mouth.

"Ahahah - yes."

With that, she jumped into the air. At the very height of her leap, the grip around your body instantly loosened; gravity's hard tugging felt more like a soft embrace. With less time than it took to blink, she'd changed into squid form and flipped around three times. You were caught between the wriggling tentacles for a second, before they flung you out. Finally, freedom-!

The thought quickly passed once you saw your destination: a glob of ketchup resting on a french fry! You flew through the air, a nice view of the inky city below, before landing inside with a teensy sploosh. A little bit of the batter crumbled beneath your torso, warming it with processed potato.

"Eh, pretty sweet, but not Dopefish-fresh. Like, an 72%."

As you pull yourself away to find the origin of the booming voice, you find yourself with something terrible facing you. A recognizably humanoid face, soft and nearly poreless. Albino hair with an ice cream cup-esque hat. Something resembling a black mask covering the gentle yellow eyes, white eyebrows pointed upwards right above. If you had to read it, she looked fairly smug, but not confrontational - though her mood was the least of your worries.

"Yeesh... Who appointed you minister of freshness?"

The grin Marie shot back revealed sharp teeth, clenched tightly against each other - you could only shudder imagining their chomping power. The maw stretched open, wall of white coming apart to let a tongue slither out. It dripped with saliva, crawling towards your ketchup trap; the pink surface quickly reached the french fry and skillfully seized it. Facing her taste buds and sugary breath, you felt your sanity level drop to the seafloor. Like a Lovecraftian protagonist, you had seen things humans were not meant to see; and an uncaring, tentacled family of Elder Gods had decided to accept you as a sacrifice. As the supple lips closed around you, you could only writhe madly in hopes that the monolithic Marie would notice. The light disappeared, sending you into the ocean of drool - the only signal of the outside world faint words muffled by her jaw's rocking movements:

"Hey, Marie? It looks like there was something icky on that french fry."

The rocking of her tongue and teeth instantly become a tsunami of motion. Waves of drool wash up behind you, quickly ejecting your body from between her lips like a water slide. With quick reflexes, Callie noticed you moving through the air - and caught you in one hand. She moved it slightly, resting you between the fingers and palm.

The sky was replaced with the two Squid Sisters eagerly peering down, large eyes scanning the "icky thing" that fell into Marie's meal.

Callie ran her other hand over your arms and legs, bending them gently as a test of flexibility. "Only four limbs... Waitaminnut! Eight is a multiple of four! Marie, this thing's an Octarian spy!" Her face moved into a look of shock, still scanning you for movement as the sharp teeth and smooth lips moved. "How much do you know, four-legs?"

While you attempt to speak up, the other squid sister chimes in: "And you thought I did a good Cap'n Cuttlefish impression..." Marie's eyes held a slight hint of sadness in them, as if she was quietly apologetic of her actions earlier. Or perhaps just holding pity for such a tiny, pathetic thing. "Looks an awful lot like those primitive creatures Gramps showed us. But he never told us they were that small."

"D'you think I can make it spew ink?" Experimentally, Callie loomed one finger over you, and pressed it down hard on your chest. It winded you easily; you gasped for air and struggled against the finger for a moment, face turning multiple colours. Disappointed, the squid lifted her grasp on you, letting you breathe again. "Hmph. It's kinda wimpy."

Marie prodded on her sister's arm, looking impatient. "Callie, I know you're happy that my snack came with a surprise toy inside or whatever - but we've gotta broadcast the news." She added: "Like, NOW."

"Fine, then." Callie's left arm flopped downwards, dejected. Staring closer to you, she decided:
15523222222212.title: Calamari Chaos!

choices: Take you along on another activity
155232222222121.content:
"I'll keep it someplace safe in the meantime."

Callie plucked your body from her palm. For a good moment, you were hanging in midair by one arm, jammed between the alarmingly-smooth index and thumb of this super-sized Squid Sister. It felt like you could just slip out easily, and hit the floor - your body turning to nothing but a slight tint of red in the paint puddles below. She kept eying you over, her immense, flowery pupils still showing suspicion.

Before your could speak, an echoing voice cut you off: "Could you put him somewhere TODAY, Callie?" Marie had her squishy arms crossed, and the tapping of her foot below was like continuous thunderclaps.

"Alright already, geez!" She shrugged, accidentally letting you slip loose - and, once again, hurdling towards Marie. You tried shutting your eyes, but either the air pressure or sheer sense of terror made it impossible - so you were given a full, high definition of your flight destination. And, as if you hadn't too close to both of the squid family already, chance set you flying right into the green-coated chest.

She stared at you awkwardly for a moment - looking unusually alarmed, considering her previous laid-back gaze. If she weren't so terrifyingly huge, it could almost seem helpless and lost. Slowly, the bright eyes narrowed to an angry squint, and her mouth shrank to a (relatively-speaking) teensy pout, pointed at her partner; you could see the underside of her chin.

"What? WHAT? That looks safe enough to me." She giggled slyly, tugging on Marie's arm. "We're ready for the air!"

Your environment jiggled slightly as they dashed into the studio. The continual motion, bumping back and forth, combined with the storm-like crashing of feet below, the dampness coating your body, and the smell of salty snacks permeating the air, gave you sea sickness. Atop the "safe place", the once-gentle face shot down to you. "Stay hidden."

You nodded silently in her shadow. Looking out, you were in the center of a recording studio, with a few crew members wandering around - seemingly unaware of your presence. And to the right, only barely past Marie's reach - which was a considerable length to you - Callie stood with a prize-winning smile.

"Hold on to your tentacles..."

Marie adopted a similar, but calmer smirk. Despite your presence, it seemed oddly natural and relaxed. "...It's Inkopolis News Time!"

The camera crew stood miles into distance. Even Marie's arms, relaxing to her sides, looked impossibly far away. No matter which way you moved, you would only end up at another spot on the Squid Sister's chest. It was so supple, though, it felt like you could sink in at any moment - lost in the imperceptible ridges.

A cheerful boom hurdled into your right ear: "Let's unveil the current regular battle stages!"

"All right!" The green-clad woman's voice rang through your head even harder. She wasn't raising it as loud as her excitable sister - but being so close to her vocal cords, you could feel every word vibrating through her body. Your limbs practically turned to ink at the low (yet bubbly) tone. Everything felt like it was shaking, even after she'd finished speaking.

Behind you, on a monitor wider than a football stadium, a colourful landscape appeared.

The purple-clad sister pointed to the screen. "So, Marie, how would you plan your attack here?" The faraway Callie could still see you. Her eyes peeked covertly to her sister's bosom, right where you trembled. She made a subtle hand gesture, like someone petting a dog - but faster. You could tell she was grinding her giant, pointed teeth through her smile.

"Uhhhh... shoot lots of ink?" Evidently, your holder felt you shuddering. You could see her great neck twisting down, a bit of wetness forming on the back. She looked at you through her round nose - mouth shut in a tiny frown of frustration and disgust. Her immense eyes kept that same expression as earlier - a mix of exasperation and pity. From your perspective, staring up at an immense figure, it felt like the entire world had its looming eyes pointed down on your pathetic state.

Thankfully, it didn't last long. Marie's eyes darted back up to the camera, showing you the underside of her jaw. Soon, your vision was replaced with the pure, white surface of her glove. It hid you from the broadcast; but the force of even that subtle movement squeezed you hard. Between the Inkling woman's finger and the surface of her chest, you had hard pressure on every side of your tiny form, fully engulfing your senses. Your head pounded. Then your ribs. Then your arms.

The squashing motion was just too much. Within what must have been under a second, but felt like ten minutes, the pressure launched you from her breast. The world whirred by again, a seizure-inducing mix of bright colours and movement. For better or worse, you didn't land far off. Your body was buried deeper in her cleavage, the velocity and reduced friction from the smooth surface pushing you a good ways down her shirt.

Outside, the broadcast continued. "So, the key to blattling here is--" Callie's voice was now muffled by skin and clothes, hiding the world from your sight. It was as if all of Inkopolis was painted black and green.

Now, Marie's tone shook you once again: "Hold up--did you just say "blattling"? Bahahaha!" It echoed through your spine, reverberating harshly. The laughter lasted longer than was really appropriate - and you could feel her arms twitching a little. It seemed your shaking was slightly ticklish. You made a try at climbing back out - but her skin was far too smooth to get a solid hold on. In fact, it felt like your efforts were only getting you deeper in her cleavage.

For a split second, you pondered what strange evolutionary routes these sea creatures crossed for their species to develop mammary glands.

Finally, a now-familiar, garbled voice echoed from the other end of your prison walls: "Until next time..." Another shiver took you. Behind the mountains that made up Marie's skin, you felt her taking a long breath in, filling her lungs - or whatever Inklings had. Her breath and heartbeat held in place for a split second.

"STAAAAY FRESH!"

Two words. Two words, and a goofy pose. That alone sounded and felt like the sky crashing down on you. A slight jiggle from Marie's tit translated to you as a crushing slam, its force rippling through your body. Two supple walls on either end kneaded your pathetic form. The reverberating words and wiggles shattered you even more, surrounding your body. Did the Squid Sister know how terrifying it was inside here?

Within a few seconds, her breathing returned to a normal pace. The shaking ended; but you were still cushioned between her breasts. But at least now you'd have their full attention.

...Right?

After a pause - presumably for the crew to leave - Callie spoke outside. "Congrats, Marie! The paparazzi's going to be crazy about your weird twitching and disappearing mole! As if we needed MORE weird coverage."

The response came out quieter than usual, but fast - she was obviously trained at comebacks. "What is this, the Salty Spittoon? I -tried- to get the surprise toy under control, but I don't know if it even understands me. Probably too primitive - a brain that size can't hold much."

"Maaaybe your toy's too busy SPYING on us to obey orders!"

"Maaaybe it wouldn't be able to gawk at us if you hadn't tossed it at my knockers!" You felt one tit receding gently as she put a hand on it.

You felt shaking from footsteps, and the sound of Callie's breathing got louder. "I can't make decisions under pressure!"

It felt like the pressure on your own body decrease. Marie's hand pushed the walls of flesh aside slightly. She scooped you up from her chest - squeezing your head, and jiggling you a little to pry you loose. "Come on, get out of there, little thing..."

The other sister instantly leaped in to help. She held onto Marie's wrist, tugging hard - and increasing the force on your body. Soon, they dislodged you - putting you in the white-haired squid's hand this time, with both of them staring you down.

"I still can't get over how tiny it is." Callie's looming finger poked you in the torso, releasing the wind from your teensy lungs and sending you tumbling to the glove-fabric floor. It almost looked as if her eyes were glowing when she saw you gasping for air. "Hee, stop that!" She chuckled. "You're making it way too hard for me to stay angry at you!"

Marie shrugged, still concerned. "Guess that's why these things died out. I can't imagine how it'd defend itself against predators." She smirked ambiguously after that. You started to wonder what kinds of "predators" she had in mind.

Callie pushed her shoulder a bit. "I'm still PRETTY sure it's some Octarian scheme. How the heck would an extinct species get here? And if they're running out of room in Octo Valley, it makes sense that their weapons would be space-efficient." She crossed her arms. "Just common logic, Marie."

The other sister cut you off. It was almost as if they were purposefully silencing you. "No, that's wild guessing. If we really want to find out, we'll have to run some experiments. Find out what kinda traits this little thing has - elasticity, endurance, solubility..."

Callie shook her head. "Or squeeze it until it decides to start giving us some answers!"

"I see absolutely no way that could backfire and destroy the last remnants of an extinct species." Marie rolled her eyes.

The way they looked at each other, it was almost as if they were more intent on proving a point to each other than actually finding out what you were doing there. Your fate was entirely in the Squid Sisters' hands - and after some bickering, they decided to...
155232222222121.title: Someplace "Safe"

1552322222221211.content:
"Well I don't see how us trying to guess what it's here for will help when we can just ask it." Said Marie as she turned her attention back to you, this was after them arguing about ditching you, prodding you, and you were sure Callie at one point made a reference towards dissecting you, which certainly alarmed you. You were a little nervous as both of them were looking at you, waiting to see if you'd say anything.

"I-I-" you started but realized you didn't know what you wanted to say, you didn't know what you COULD say to get them to ease up on what they want to do. Are they going to believe that you were here because their entire world was just a video game that you had intended to play when a bright light just plopped you here at such a tiny height. After a few seconds of silence Callie just rolled her eyes. "Yeah, what a help this is Marie, the thing probably can't even talk, it's brain is probably too primitive, as you suggested like...5 minutes ago" She poked at you again and that was finally what set you off.

"I CAN talk thank you very much! And i'm not an it i'm a he, and i'm not a thing i'm a human!" You said, finally having taken enough from these two and their constant prodding at you, verbally and physically. Simultaneously both looked at you quite shocked at your outburst. If there was ever a time to get your story off your chest, it was now.

"You want to know why i'm here? I'd like to know that too! All I know is I woke up in the square and YOU-" you said as you pointed at Callie "stepped on me doing your little dance, damn near crushing me until you leaped into the air sending me flying into HER food! After that and a near death experience of being squid food I was found and you both decided to take your time either poking at me with you finger, throwing me around, crushing me or throwing me around in your clothes, and trying to suffocate me! Between all that you've been trying to call me a spy, or a toy, or a dumb primitive! No, i'm not any of that! I just woke up here! I was just trying to relax and unwind at home! I didn't ask to be tormented by TWO STUPID SQUID SISTERS!" You finally finished, satisfied and trying to catch your breath after that tirade your senses finally returned. Maybe insulting the two titans that had caused you such havoc without even trying was a bad idea. You didn't want to know what would happen if you managed to tick them off. With a sense of dread you looked up at their faces again to see their initial shock had changed to expressions of...
1552322222221211.title: Breaking point

15523222222212111.content:
You know you should of regretted your outburst but you don't. After being treaded on and treated as a lower being, you feel like your rage is justified, and you feel like they'll see your point of view. Apparently not. "Your voice is so high pitch and cute!" Callie called as she plucked you into her hands. She brings you to her face and starts cooing over how cute you are. Marie however had a much more different attitude about this "Little punk, thing he can yell at the squid sisters, hand him over Callie, I'll teach him a lesson" Marie said as she extended a hand over to her sister. "No I won't, he wants to stay with me" Callie said holding you against her cheek. Since Callie seems to be acting nice and Marie wants to hurt you, you would have to agree with Callie on that point.

"Uh Fine" Marie said as she backed off "So what do you wanna do with the small rude Primitive". Wow every time she starts talking you think you like Marie less and less "I don't know to be honest, I've never had a pet so maybe he will be my first one" Callie said as she was still inspecting your body. "What, I don't wanna be your pet!" you shout up to Callie.

"I agree, just leave him on the side of street and let him fend for himself." Marie added Callie who just brushed off Marie's idea continued to coo over you with saying how cute you were. Marie stood up and gave you a dirty look, she obviously doesn't like the way her sister has taken a liken to you and the glare she gives you makes you feel a bit scared. "Works done, so I'm heading home. Are you coming or what? Marie said to her sister Callie.

Callie looked at you then back to her sister. "I think I need to make a stop first,I'll be home later." Marie leaves and Callie looks at you, looking at you with a look of excitedment "are you ready little pet. Because we're going ________
15523222222212111.title: Caring Callie And Angry Marie

choices: Marie is sitting on the couch
155232222222121112.content:
"Because we're going shopping!!!" Callie squeeled as she seems pretty excited. Whether it was a squid girl or a normal girl, they all love shopping. She reaches down and grabs her purse that was near her feet. Her purse was light green like she was. It had lipstick, a wallet, gum and other things that a girl would have in a purse. She lowers you and drops you right in. You land right next to the lipstick and look up to see Callie smiling down at you "This is gonna be so FUN!, going shopping with my little pet. You can sleep in there until we get there okay" Callie then closed the Purses lid and your In darkness. Deciding that you can't possibly get out. You lay down and get comfortable. That was until Callie started moving and you get thrown around in the purse.

After about 30 minutes Callie opens the purse "Come out little pet, I've got a surprise for you" Callie called. Since you've been trying to avoid being squished by the purse's contents for the last 30 minutes, You climb out as fast as you can. You were greeted by a stunning view. You were currently in a females changing room that shoppers use to try on clothes. And there Callie was wearing a gorgeous Green dress that hugged her body. It started at her breasts barely containing them to her ass which the dress hugged very well. Since you've been with Callie this was the first time you were memorized by her beauty. You couldn't even look away because you were stunned by her looks. "So I take my little pet likes what he sees" Callie said as she noticed how turned on you were. You couldn't even respond "hahaha! I think I'll buy this, just in case you get disobedient and I need to keep you in line" she walked over towards you seductively and pushed you back in the purse with her long finger. She closes it and continues shopping.

After a long trip of shopping with Callie and dodging stuff in the purse she returns home. She was carrying bags of things. Everything she bought she showed you first, from a cage to keep you in to pet food. It shows that she obviously wants to and is planning on keeping you. She opens the door to the rich apartment her and her sister share and ____________________
155232222222121112.title: Shopping With Callie

15523222222212112.content:
"Jeez...Sorry about that.." Callie apologized while feeling like weeks old chum."It's just that anything about humans usually depicts them as horrifying and dumb monsters that eat inklings and their eggs."

"He didn't have to insult us either.." Marie countered,while she does feel bad for insulting him.It didn't give him the right to do the same.

"You know what! We will do some special something for you." Marie cheerfully said as she grabs you with her right boneless hand. She places you on the coffee table,and wink to her best friend and cousin."Right Marie!"

Marie just shrugged and nodded. But she can't shake the feeling that something weird will happen...


What happens next?
15523222222212112.title: remorse and sympathy

155232222222121121.content:
"Take off your shoes and socks." The tiny boy grumply ordered the idols and secret agents. He already experienced their weirdly human like breasts(which has no nipples.). So hell yeah,he wants to see and feel some squid feet.

Besides he really want see if an inkling's feet are big.Or just it's some internet bullshit.

The now blushing squid sisters looked each other weirdly,but they did what he say. They presented their feet on the table.

Callie's dry and semi hard feet was wide,chubby,and meaty,and her toes were kinda short. And Marie's feet was the exact opposite. But they share two qualities,they were definitely big,and they reek very much.

Marie's leathery looking soles smelt of some type of spicy and very strong smelling cheese,and some type of flower. While Callie's feet had an sharp and bitter vinegary cornchip stench and a sickly fruity perfume.

It seems that them being mega idols,and undercover soldiers has taken quite a toll on them.

The two different smells was unimaginably addicting to the tiny boy,and made his crotch painfully hard.

The squid sisters had few things in common. One of those things is their mutual dislike of their big feet. When they was younger,they didn't see nothing wrong about them,but over the years they start to get...very self-conscious and disgusted about them and their size.And in inkling standards,they're bigger than a lot of normal sized human feet

It certainly didn't help that they absolutely stink right now. But seeing the small human look at them...made both of them kinda flattered and feel weird and funny.

Marie had her head in hands and muttering "This is so fucking weird..." and "Why I agree to do this". And Callie had a silent and shaky smile that was very transparent.

After a minute of savouring the tainted air. He..

As you open up your eyes to find yourself in some kind of different world, you find yourself in some kind of jail cell... Of course, the bars were wide enough for you to escape from at your small size... But how did you get there?

It would seem that you didn't have much time to think about that question as you could begin to hear footsteps echoing in the halls outside, coming towards the cell you were inside of... You look around, trying to find a place to hide... It would seem there was only one place to hide within the room... Underneath the bed...

1552322222222222222221211.content:
Deciding you'd rather not risk finding out if this jail had rats or roaches, you wait where you were... Plus, if you waited for somebody to see you, maybe you could get some answers.

The footsteps continued, sounding as though they were getting closer and closer... And soon, somebody comes into view... The attractive form of Detective Carrie! But that didn't make any sense... She was from a video game, the same one you'd been playing before you showed up here... How was she really right in front of you?!

Carrie stopped outside of the cell, looking inside... And quickly seeming a mixture of confused and upset. "Wait... What the hell?! Where did he go?!" Carrie said... You were unable to tell if she meant you or somebody else... Carrie quickly pulled out a key from her pocket, unlocking the cell door... She opened up the cell, quickly walking in, likely to start looking for this missing person she mentioned...
1552322222222222222221211.title: Wait Where You Are

15523222222222222222212111.content:

You take a few seconds to think about how exactly you're going to do it... And you soon decide to...
15523222222222222222212111.title: Try To Get Her Attention

155232222222222222222121111.content:
Deciding not to risk your life by climbing the giant woman, you take a deep breath before trying to shout up to her... "Detective Carrie! Down here!" You called up to her... And it would seem she actually heard you! At the moment, she'd been looking under the bed, so her ears were closer to your level then they would've been... And that was probably just enough for her to hear you...

She seemed a little bit confused, looking around from her current location... You crossed your fingers that she'd see you... It took roughly half a minute of her thoroughly examining the floors of the room, but eventually, her eyes landed on your tiny form... "Aha! There you are!" She said... So it was you she was looking for for...

She quickly made her way over to you, sitting down on her knees when she got to you in order to get a closer look... "Shrunk yourself to try to escape eh? Well I don't know how you did it, but it seems like your little plan backfired!" Carrie said, starting to reach her hand towards you... You had no idea what she was talking about, but it was safe to assume it wasn't something good... You began feeling a littler nervous as her giant hand was reaching for you... Perhaps getting her attention wasn't the best idea...
155232222222222222222121111.title: Try Shouting To Her

You were with Jill when she broke into the museum vault." Carrie said, putting her free hand on her hip. "W-What? I-I don't know what you're talking about! I-I just woke up here!" You said to her... "Hmm... It looks like a normal holding cell won't be able to contain you anymore... Guess I'll have to put you somewhere else for now..." Carrie said to you... She stands up, and you see her begin to...

info.brief_description: You are shrunk in the realm of nintendo! It's basically the same as any shrinking fic.
info.description:
Well welcome to my Interactive!

I'll try and give a hand from time to time in the additions once we get going, but, as I'm terrible at beginnings, I'm afraid you guys'll have to lay the groundwork.


It's a pretty standard shrinking fic though, just with new characters. Here are the rules:


-no sex (sexual reference is fine)
-no toilet stuff (again, reference is fine)
-No male interaction
-Characters may be killed

-I want proper grammar and spelling. No tieping liek thiz. I find that writing like that greatly detracts from the appeal of an interactive, no matter what kind.
-Additions should be at LEAST three lines long. No one liners like "She stepped on him and he died"
-Have fun!
